business

Class Restaurant

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • business.Restaurant
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Restaurant
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    Restaurant class defines methods used for basic processing of orders and menu items
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Restaurant

        public Restaurant(java.util.HashMap<Order,java.util.Collection<MenuItem>> orders,
                  java.util.ArrayList<MenuItem> menu)
        Constructor used for initializing a Restaurant object
        Parameters:
        orders - The orders of the restaurant
        menu - The menu of the restaurant
        Precondition:
        The orders and menu are not null

      • Restaurant

        public Restaurant()
        Constructor used for creating a new object with no menu items and no orders

    • Method Detail

      • getMenu

        public java.util.ArrayList<MenuItem> getMenu()
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of MenuItems representing the menu of the restaurant

      • getOrders

        public java.util.HashMap<Order,java.util.Collection<MenuItem>> getOrders()
        Returns:
        Returns an Hashmap with key Order and value a collection of MenuItems representing the orders of the restaurant

      • createMenuItem

        public MenuItem createMenuItem(java.lang.String itemName,
                               double price,
                               java.util.ArrayList<MenuItem> composition)
        Method used for creating and inserting a new MenuItem to the menu
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the item
        price - The price of the item
        composition - The composition of the item (in case it is a CompositeProduct)
        Returns:
        Returns the created MenuItem
        Precondition:
        Checks if itemName is not null and price is greater than 0
        Postcondition:
        Checks if size of the menu was incremented
        Invariant:
        Checks if the method maintains the class invariant (see isWellFormed method)

      • deleteMenuItem

        public void deleteMenuItem(MenuItem menuItem)
        Method used for removing a MenuItem from the menu of the restaurant
        Parameters:
        menuItem - The MenuItem object to be deleted
        Precondition:
        Checks if the given MenuItem is in the menu
        Postcondition:
        Checks if size of the menu was decremented
        Invariant:
        Checks if the method maintains the class invariant (see isWellFormed method)

      • editMenuItem

        public void editMenuItem(MenuItem menuItem,
                         java.lang.String itemName,
                         double price,
                         java.util.ArrayList<MenuItem> composition)
        Method used for editing an existing MenuItem from the Menu.
        Parameters:
        menuItem - The MenuItem to be changed
        itemName - The new name of the MenuItem, use null value for not changing it
        price - The new price of the MenuItem, use -1 value for not changing it
        composition - The new composition of the MenuItem, use null for not changing it
        Precondition:
        Checks if the given MenuItem is in the menu, Checks if price is greater than 0, if it is not -1
        Invariant:
        Checks if the method maintains the class invariant (see isWellFormed method)

      • createOrder

        public Order createOrder(int orderId,
                         java.util.Date date,
                         int tableNumber,
                         java.util.List<MenuItem> items)
        Method used for creating and inserting a new Order to the orders of the restaurant. This method notifies the Chef in case there are CompositeProducts in the list
        Parameters:
        orderId - The id of the Order
        date - The date of the Order
        tableNumber - The number of the table of the Order
        items - The list of ordered items
        Returns:
        Returns the created order
        Precondition:
        Checks if id is greater or equal than 0, Checks if date and items are not null, Checks if table number and size of the item`s list is greater than 0
        Postcondition:
        Checks if size of the orders was incremented
        Invariant:
        Checks if the method maintains the class invariant (see isWellFormed method)

      • computePrice

        public double computePrice(Order order)
        Method used for computing the total price for an Order
        Parameters:
        order - The order used
        Returns:
        Returns a double value representing the total price
        Precondition:
        Checks if the given order is in the orders list
        Invariant:
        Checks if the method maintains the class invariant (see isWellFormed method)

      • generateBill

        public void generateBill(Order order)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Method used for generating bills for an order
        Parameters:
        order - The used order
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws IOException in case something happened with the IO connection
        Precondition:
        Checks if the given order is in the orders list

      • productExist

        public boolean productExist(java.lang.String itemName)
        Method used for checking if a MenuItem with the specified name already exists in the menu
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the MenuItem to be checked
        Returns:
        Returns true if the MenuItem with the specified name is in the menu, otherwise false
        Precondition:
        Checks if the given name is not null

      • getOrderById

        public Order getOrderById(int id)
        Method used for querying an order from the orders list based on the order id
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the order to be searched
        Returns:
        Returns the founded order, null if the order was not found
        Precondition:
        Checks if id is greater than 0

      • getMenuItemByName

        public MenuItem getMenuItemByName(java.lang.String itemName)
        Method used for querying a MenuItem from the menu based on the MenuItem`s name
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the MenuItem to be searched
        Returns:
        Returns the founded MenuItem, null if the MenuItem was not found
        Precondition:
        Checks if the MenuItem`s name is not null
